poem:
The Road Forward

Jaguar purrs  
in a world  
of whispered labels –  
headlights bright  
against the haze.  

Embrace each curve,  
each twist unseen,  
where paths  
of youth and  
corporate code collide,  
colors blend.  

The wheels of change  
roll steady,  
past adages  
crumbling like  
loved Lego bricks –  
beyond old roads  
and shadows lingering.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Republican talk of Jaguar’s ‘wokeness’ is overblown, but it has a long road ahead James Bond. Washington state. Corporate America. Boy scouts. Delta airlines. The Hasbro toy company. College campuses. Emojis. Pizza Hut, Nike, Lego, M&Ms. Bud Light. This is a small selection of the things that Republicans and the rightwing commentariat has branded woke. And in the past couple of weeks, the car company Jaguar has found itself added to that list. It began". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
